glsa.title: GEGL: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in GEGL might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: GEGL is a graph-based image processing framework.

description.p: Multiple integer overflows in GEGL may cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PPM image using an application linked against GEGL, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All gegl users should upgrade to the latest version:
Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools such as revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying some of these packages.
